text: Keg @ Shuffledog, Leeds. Deep amber in colour with a small head. The pomegranate is light but evident in both aroma and taste, providing a light appealing sweetness to an ale with an easy-drinking texture.

Keg Third of a Pint at BrewDog Collabfest, BrewDog Clapham, London in Oct 2016 - Reddish Amber in colour. Average frothy off-white head. Fair lacing. Malty; toasty malts, grainy, rye?, toffee. Fruity; pomegranate, berry fruits. Hoppy; earthy hops. Bittersweet very grainy malty fruity and quite earthy. Quite dry. Very drinkable. (2016-10-24)
Keg @Brewdog Stirling, 25.11.2016. Pours copper/reddish, white head. Nose is fruity, big orange and pomegranate, toffee/caramel sweetness, taste is along the same lines as the nose.

October 2016 - Keg at Brewdog Shepherds Bush as Alphabet / BrewDog Leicester Kings Blood. Dark brown with an orange hue, foamy off-white head, dotted lacing. Aroma is raspberry and cherry, lots of blackcurrant squash, black forest gateau, lesser pomegranate. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is earthy, floral, plum, slightly salty in the finish. Very nice. Irish ale???? Sure. (3.7)

On tap at Brewdog Sheffield. Aroma of honey, pomegranate and dried tea leafs. Colour is amber, or amber-red. Taste: First there is caramel, continues with fruit and sweet tones on middle, bittery finnish.
Tap at BrewDog Manchester. Burnt copper shade. Thin head. Toasty malts and lingering fruits. Pomegranate provides a decent accent but I think I wouldve liked this more without the fruit interfering.

Keg at BD Soho, 21/10/16.
Reddish amber with a well appointed light beige cap.
Nose is sweet malts, candied fruit peel, red berry tingle, light spice, raspberry jam.
Taste comprises biscuit malt, earthy hop layer, caramel, light spice, biscuit, jammy fruits.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, earthy hop tunes in the close.
Solid for style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at the Brewdog shepherds Bush. A reddy copper coloured pour with a lasting fine pink head. Aroma is sweet jammy fruits, fruit cake, cherry, sweet fruits, pop tart. Flavour is composed of sweet jammy fruits, blackberry, candied raspberry. Palate is medium sweet, highish carbonation, dry powdered carbonation. Not bad.

Clear red beer, off white head. Soft, fruity aroma. Flavour is a touch more direct. Apple, toffee, citrusy hop. A bit of sour, zesty aftertaste. A light, sweet, malty flavour just cutting through it all a bit. Lovely.

BD Edinburgh collabfest. Looks like a red ale. Pours ruby/copper. Thin white head. Aroma of toffee and cherries. More like pomegranate on the taste with lots of juice but its a bit sour for me. Interesting but 1/3 as part of a flight was probably enough.
Keg at brewdog Shepards bush... Copper red.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet toffee fruit malt nose... Soft sweet toffee fruit malt
Keg at BrewDog Birmingham; clear ruby red pour with a bubbly white head, aroma has red fruit, taste has pomegranate, wispy malts, quite fruity and refreshing.

On tap @ BrewDog, Soho. This one has a blurry deeper golden looking color. On the top theres a medium sized lacing beigeish head, lots of lacings down the glass. On the aroma it has a soft biscuity sweetness. Malt-caramel and a little red Berry fruitiness. It sure has a distinct flavor this. Really candy sweet - yet it has a strong bitterness. Weed-bitterness. Its mild oily in the mouth and its just above average on the carbonation. A little astringent after a while. Good old saft. Dry long tail. A little strange perhaps, but I still kinda liked it. 21.10.2016

Keg at BDSB. It pours hazy dark red with a medium white head. The aroma is sweet, juicy, very fruity, massive pomegranate vibe, jammy and Victoria sponge. The taste is bitter - sweet, jammy, loads of pomegranate, strawberry lipbalm, light spice, muffing, Victoria sponge, earthy and pithy citrus with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Smells good, tastes a bit weird.

Keg at BDSB - London. Pours clear ruby with a creamy topping. The nose has some ripe citrus, pine, berries. Light sweet flavour with light earthy bitterness, some leathery berries, brown bread. Medium bodied with average carboantion. Sturdy earthy bitterness to finalise, with more ripe and leathery berries, orange peel, toasted grains. Lingering earthy bitterness. Not bad.

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Red golden with a thin head. Toffee and spices, rye bread with red berries. Bubblegum with nutty marzipan. Fairly juicy. Red berry fruitiness. Earthy, dry and spicy. Drying palate. Good

Keg at BD Soho. It pours a clean copper color with a medium beige head. Aroma is somewhat fruity and malty with notes of melon and pomegranate. Taste is lightly malty sweet upfront with subdued pomegranate red berries sweetness and a closing astringent bitterness. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, ok
